name: Asian-Inspired Guacamole
author: Mal D.
summary: Wanted to give some Asian influences to guacamole one night, so I found some random items in the fridge and pantry and whipped it up. It looks ugly upon completion, but has definite delicious flair! Use with chips, enchiladas, or tacos, or whatever else you think benefits from guacamole. Add spices to your liking.
ingredients: ¼  green bell pepper, finely chopped
1 teaspoon lemongrass paste (such as Gourmet Garden™)
directions: Combine tomatoes, bell pepper, and basil in a large bowl or mortar
Add lemongrass paste, salt, lime juice, gochujang, curry powder, and cumin, in that order
Mash and combine using a pestle or wooden spoon until guacamole appears brown with specks of color
